An Abrupt_change_of_surface_normal is a type of . This entity asserts that a
has a portion where normals at two nearby points on the abruptly change. The measurement requirement corresponding to this entity requires that the measurement shall calculate the scalar product of normal vectors at two nearby points on the surface. If a pair of points is found where the scalar product value is negative, then the surface shape is judged to abruptly change there. A normal vector shall be ignored if magnitude of either of the tangent vectors is smaller than the tolerance.
A typical case to be detected by this criterion is shown in Figure 1.
Abrupt change of surface normals
a that judges satisfaction or dissatisfaction of this criterion by the sign of the scalar product of normal vectors at two nearby points on the surface.
a . The normal vector shall be ignored if the magnitude of either of the surface derivatives with respect to u and v at the points under investigation is smaller than this value.
a distance to determine nearby points. A pair of points is regarded as a target of the check if distance between them is smaller than this value.

A Curve_with_excessive_segments is a type of . This entity asserts that a or a has too many segments. The measurement requirement corresponding to this entity requires calculation of the number of segments. For a , number of segments is calculated from the number of control points and the degree by the following formula:
(number of segments) = SIZEOF () - ().
For a , the number of segments is the value of SIZEOF().
a that tests the number of segments against the given threshold.

A Curve_with_small_curvature_radius is a type of . This entity asserts that a curve has a point where curvature radius is smaller than the threshold value. The measurement requirement corresponding to this entity requires that the measurement shall calculate the minimum value of curvature radii at the sufficient number of points on the curve.
A typical case to be detected by this criterion is illustrated in Figure 2.
Curve with small curvature radius
a that tests the measured curvature radius against the given threshold.

A Disconnected_face_set is a type of . This entity asserts that s in a are not arcwise connected. The measurement requirement corresponding to this entity requires that the measurement shall create groups of faces in the that are connected via edges or vertices. If two or more groups are created for one , then it implies the existence of disconnection.

a that tests if the in the
are not arcwise connected, which is the case ’TRUE’, or not.

A Discontinuous_geometry is a type of that is a supertype of criteria for detecting geometry data with discontinuity.

An Edge_with_excessive_segments is a type of . This entity asserts that geometry of an contains excessive number of segments. This criterion is applicable only when the underlying curve is of type . The measurement requirement corresponding to this entity requires that the measurement shall calculate the bounded portion of its underlying curve trimmed by the start vertex and the end vertex. Then it shall count the number of the segments included in this portion.
a that tests the calculated number of segments against the given threshold.

An Entirely_narrow_face is a type of . This entity asserts that a is too narrow. A is too narrow if for every point on the
there is a point on the boundary within half the distance of the threshold value. The measurement requirement corresponding to this entity requires that the measurement shall calculate minimum distance from selected points on the to the boundary. If calculated value exceeds half the distance tolerance represented by
attribute, then the is not narrow.
The measurement of this criterion is illustrated in Figure 3.
The measurement considers a sphere whose diameter is and whose centre is at any point on the and checks if the sphere does not intersect with the boundary of the . The test is complete when one such internal point is detected.
Measurement of an entirely narrow face
a that tests if the face is narrow at all the inspected points, which is the case 'TRUE', or not.
the tolerance value used to check if the face is narrow or not.
The of and the of corresponding to this entity shall be of type .
The of corresponding to this entity shall be of type .
The associated with this entity shall not be of type .
If the accuracy is specified for this measurement, its shall be of type .

An Entirely_narrow_solid is a type of . This entity asserts that the width of a is entirely infinitesimal. The measurement requirement corresponding to this entity requires that the measurement shall calculate for sufficient number of selected points within the minimum distance to the bounding shells. If this exceeds half the distance tolerance, then is not narrow.
The measurement of this criterion is illustrated in Figure 4.
The measurement considers a sphere whose diameter is and whose centre is at any point inside the and checks if the sphere does not intersect with the boundary of the . The test is complete when one such internal point is detected.
Measurement of entirely narrow solid
a that tests if the solid is narrow for all the inspected points, which is the case 'TRUE', or not.
the tolerance value used to check if the solid is narrow or not.

An Entirely_narrow_surface is a type of . This entity asserts that a surface is entirely narrow. A surface is narrow if for every point on the surface there is a point on the boundary within half the distance tolerance. The measurement requirement corresponding to this entity requires that the measurement shall calculate for selected points on the surface minimum distance to the boundary. If this exceeds half the distance tolerance, then the surface is not narrow.
The measurement of this criterion is illustrated in Figure 5.
d is the distance from a point on the surface to its boundary.
Measurement of an entirely narrow face
a that tests if the surface is entirely narrow, which is the case 'TRUE', or not.
the tolerance value to check if the surface is narrow or not.

has inconsistent relationships between the degree, the number of knot values, the knot multiplicities and the number of control points. The function as defined in ISO 10303-42 checks these values. The assessment of this entity shall test if the function
as defined in ISO 10303-42:2003, 4.6.22 returns 'FALSE' or not.
This criterion corresponds to the violation of WR1 of
as defined in ISO 10303-42.

An Extreme_patch_width_variation is a type of . This entity asserts that widths of the interval of knots of a are not balanced but significantly varies. This is an inappropriate case for surface design and may lead to errors in the processes such as modification of the surface, projection of a point or a curve onto the surface. The measurement requirement corresponding to this entity requires that the measurement shall calculate ratio of length of patch boundaries of two adjacent patches in all possible parametric direction combinations so that it can be compared with the given threshold in assessment.
In Figure 6, dashed lines show patch boundary curves and solid lines show natural boundary curves of a surface. l1 and l2 are one pair of patch boundary curve length whose ratio shall be calculated in the measurement of this criterion.
Extreme patch width variation
a that tests the measured change ratio against the given threshold.

A Face_surface_with_excessive_patches_in_one_direction is a type of . This entity asserts that geometry of a
contains excessive number of patches within its effective area of the base surface. This criterion is applicable only when the base surface is of type . The measurement requirement corresponding to this entity requires that the measurement shall obtain a part of the underlying surface by trimming it with the bounding box of the bounds of in parameter space, and then it shall calculate the number of patches of the trimmed surface both in u and v directions. The bigger one of the two shall be obtained as the maximum number of patches for comparison with the given threshold in assessment.
a that tests the calculated number of patches against the given threshold.

A Free_edge is a type of . A Free_edge asserts that a
contains one or more edges that have only one reference from a face.
If the
is a , violation to this criterion means erroneous shape. Therefore, that case shall be detected by the criterion
that is a type of .
This criterion detects open shells which are intended to be closed solids. Those shells are often created as a result of translation failure of closed solids.
cannot detect them when the shell is not of type .
If this criterion is applied to an open shell which represents sheet without thickness, edges representing the outer boundary of the sheet and those representing internal holes are detected. Those edges are not inappropriate.
The measurement requirement corresponding to this entity requires that the measurement shall check for all the s related to the s in the , if the is referred from some only once.

a that tests if the
contains one or more edges that has only one reference from a face, which is the case 'TRUE', or not.

A G1_discontinuity_between_adjacent_faces is a type of . A G1_discontinuity_between_adjacent_faces asserts that underlying surfaces of adjacent faces sharing an
are not G1 continuous.
This is a selective criterion for selected set of faces in particular application.
The measurement requirement corresponding to this entity requires that the measurement shall take points on the s where adjacent faces of the
exist, and shall calculate the nearest points on the geometry of related s and shall get normal vectors on both surfaces. If the face is an oriented face, its orientation shall be taken into account. It shall measure the maximum angle between the normal vectors among all the points on the
for comparison with the given threshold in assessment.

A G1_discontinuous_curve is a type of . A G1_discontinuous_curve asserts that a
has some internal point where G1 continuity is violated. The measurement requirement corresponding to this entity requires that the measurement shall calculate the maximum angle of two tangent vectors at the selected internal knot points along the
one coming to the point under inspection and the other leaving from that point, that shall be compared with the given threshold in assessment. It is sufficient to perform this check at the points where knot multiplicities are greater than or equal to the degree of the .
In Figure 8, a small black circle is a point on a curve where tangent vectors of the curve at that point are illustrated by a dashed line and a solid line. The curve shall be detected by this criterion if the angle between the dashed line and the solid line is larger than the threshold.
G1 discontinuous curve

A G1_discontinuous_surface is a type of . A G1_discontinuous_surface asserts that a
has some internal point where G1 continuity is violated. The measurement requirement corresponding to this entity requires that the measurement shall calculate the maximum angle between two tangent vectors to an isoparametric curve at each selected internal point one coming to that point and the other leaving from that point, that shall be compared with the given threshold in assessment. This check shall be performed both in u and v directions. It is sufficient to perform this check at the points where knot multiplicities are greater than or equal to the degree of the surface.

A G2_discontinuity_between_adjacent_faces is a type of . A G2_discontinuity_between_adjacent_faces asserts that underlying surfaces of adjacent faces sharing an edge are not G2 continuous.
This is a selective criterion for selected set of faces in particular application.
The measurement requirement corresponding to this entity requires that the measurement shall take points on the s where adjacent faces of the exist, and shall get principal curvature value and principal curvature direction on both surfaces. It shall measure the maximum difference between the principal curvature and the maximum angle between principal curvature directions for all the points on the curve. Curvature directions shall be compared with the plane angle threshold given by the . Let r1 and r2 be principal curvature radius values to be compared. Curvature radius change ratio is defined as ( 2*|r1-r2| ) / ( |r1| + |r2| ). Compare this value with the ratio threshold given by
to check continuity of curvature radius values.
In Figure 9, the solid arrow line illustrates a principal curvature vector of the cylindrical surface of the left face and the dashed arrow line illustrates that of a surface of the right face. This is the case where the directions of curvature vectors are same, while the curvature radii are different. In contrast, Figure 10 shows a case where curvature radii are same and curvature vectors are different. This criterion shall detect both cases.
G2 discontinuity between faces because of curvature radius difference
G2 discontinuity between faces because of curvature direction difference
a that tests the measured angle against the given threshold.
a that tests the measured change ratio of the curvature radii against the given threshold.

ext_description.p: the tolerance value to check flat shape.
ext_description.note: If the curvature radius value is larger than , that curvature value shall not be used to check curvature change ratio. If two curvature radii are larger than this value, then it shall be understood that two segments are G2 continuous. If one of the curvature radii is larger than this value and the other is smaller, then it shall be understood that two segments are G2 discontinuous.

A G2_discontinuous_curve is a type of .
A G2_discontinuous_curve asserts that a
has some internal point where G2 continuity is violated. The measurement requirement corresponding to this entity requires that the measurement shall calculate the maximum difference between the curvature radius values and the directions of the centre of curvature at the selected internal knot points along the curve. Curvature directions shall be compared with the plane angle threshold specified in the . Let r1 and r2 be curvature radius values to be compared. Curvature radius change ratio is defined as ( 2*|r1-r2| ) / ( |r1| + |r2| ). Compare this value with the ratio threshold specified in
to check continuity of curvature radius values. It is sufficient to perform this check at the points where knot multiplicities are greater than (degree - 2) of the curve.
The case where curvature directions are same, but the radii are different is shown in Figure 11. In contrast, the case where curvature radii are same while curvature directions are different is shown in Figure 12. Both cases shall be detected by this criterion.
G2 discontinuous because of the difference of curvature radius
G2 discontinuous because of the difference of curvature direction

A G2_discontinuous_surface is a type of . A G2_discontinuous_surface asserts that a
has some internal point where G2 continuity is violated. The measurement requirement corresponding to this entity requires that the measurement shall calculate the maximum difference between the curvature radius values and the directions of the principal curvatures of the isoparametric curves in the cross boundary directions at the selected internal knot points of the . Principal curvature directions shall be compared with the plane angle threshold specified in the . Let r1 and r2 be principal curvature radius values to be compared. Curvature radius change ratio is defined as ( 2*|r1-r2| ) / ( |r1| + |r2| ). Compare this value with the ratio threshold specified in to check continuity of curvature radius values. It is sufficient to perform this check at the points where knot multiplicities are greater than (degree - 2).

A Gap_between_faces_related_to_an_edge is a type of . A Gap_between_faces_related_to_an_edge asserts that the results of projection from the geometry of an
onto geometry of related s are not identical within specified threshold. The measurement requirement corresponding to this entity requires that, for all the edges related to the faces in the , the measurement shall calculate two nearest points from any point on the onto geometry of related s, and shall measure the distance between those two points. It shall obtain the maximum value of the distances calculated for each .
In Figure 14 "edge curve 1" is shared by "face surface 1" and "face surface 2." The figure at the bottom shows a cross section of the
shared by two s. The small white circle is a point on "edge curve 1" and the dashed lines are underlying surfaces of "face surface 1" and "face surface 2." Two black small circles are the points projected from the point on "edge curve 1" onto the underlying surfaces, and the distance between these points shall be evaluated. These points will be
when a defect is detected for this criterion and the location gives the maximum distance.

An Inapt_data is a type of
that is a supertype of criteria for detecting potential problem data from application point of view. Its subtypes are further classified into , , and .
Inappropriate data is not mathematically incorrect data but data which may cause problems in its applications. In some situations they may be acceptable but in other cases they may cause serious troubles. Some inappropriate data are caused by the difference of numerical precision of shape representation or the difference of shape manipulation of CAD systems. Users shall select these criteria with appropriate threshold values according to their business requirement on shape data quality.

An Inapt_geometry is a type of
that is a supertype of criteria for detecting geometrically inappropriate shape data.

An Inapt_manifold_solid_brep is a type of
and is a supertype of criteria for detecting some types of inappropriate geometric model.

An Inapt_topology is a type of
that is a supertype of criteria for detecting topologically inappropriate shape data.

An Inapt_topology_and_geometry_relationship is a type of
that is a supertype of criteria for detecting inappropriate relationship between topology and geometry.

An Inconsistent_adjacent_face_normals is a type of . This entity asserts that normals of two s that share an are not consistent with each other in an
or a . The measurement requirement corresponding to this entity requires that the measurement shall check orientation for all s related to the s in a or an .
If two adjacent faces share an edge with the same orientation, then the topological normals to the faces are in opposite senses and therefore inconsistent.
In Figure 16, an is shared by two s, face 1 and face 2, in the same orientation. Therefore, topological normals of the two faces are opposite.
Inconsistent adjacent face normals
a that tests if there exist adjacent faces which share an edge with the same orientation, which is the case 'TRUE', or not.

ext_description.p:
An Inconsistent_curve_transition_code is a type of . This entity asserts that transition codes of s in a are not consistent with the underlying geometry. The measurement requirement corresponding to this entity requires that the measurement shall check for each
in the if geometric continuity evaluated at its end point and at the start point of the next segment is consistent with its transition code within given tolerances. When the is closed, this entity requires that the measurement shall also check continuity at the end point of the last segment and at the start point of the first segment against the transition code of the last segment.

The angle between two tangent vectors, one at the end of current segment and the other at the start of the next segment shall be compared with
if the transition code is .

A check for principal normal directions is also required if the transition code is .
Difference of two curvature radius values, one at the end of current segment and the other at the start of the next segment shall also be checked if the transition code is . To check the curvature radius continuity, let r1 and r2 be the two curvature radius values. Then change ratio of the curvature radii is determined as (2*|r1-r2| ) / ( |r1| + |r2| ). If this change ratio is larger than the , then it is not curvature continuous. Distance between the end point of the current segment and the start point of the next segment shall be compared with
if the transition code is not .

Geometry having continuity greater than the transition code shall not be detected by this criterion except for the case where the start point of the first segment and the end point of the last segment are coincident although the transition code of the last segment is .

ext_descriptions.ext_description: a that tests if there exists any inconsistency between curve transition codes and the continuity of the underlying geometry.
the tolerance for checking if directions of two vectors are parallel.
the tolerance for checking if two curvature values are equal.
the tolerance for checking if two points coincide.

ext_description.p: the tolerance value to check flat shape.
ext_description.note: If the curvature radius value is larger than , that curvature value shall not be used to check curvature change ratio. If two curvature radii are larger than this value, then it shall be understood that two segments are G2 continuous. If one of the curvature radii is larger than this value and the other is smaller, then it shall be understood that two segments are G2 discontinuous.

ext_description.p:
An Inconsistent_surface_transition_code is a type of . This entity asserts that transition codes of es in a
are not consistent with the underlying geometry. The measurement requirement corresponding to this entity requires that the measurement shall check for each
in the
if geometric continuity to the next patch is consistent with corresponding transition code within given tolerances. This check shall be performed both in u and v directions. If the
under inspection is the last patch in u direction, only check for v direction is required but check with adjacent first patch in u direction is also required if the
is closed in u direction. If the
under inspection is the last patch in v direction, only check for u direction is required but check with adjacent first patch in v direction is also required if the
is closed in v direction. If the
under inspection is the last patch in both u and v directions, no check is required but check requirement in case the
is closed described above also applies. At any point on the common patch boundary, distance of the two points, one evaluated on the current patch and the other evaluated on the next patch shall be compared with
if the transition code is not .

The angle between two tangent vectors at any point of the common patch boundary, one at the end of current patch and the other at the start of the next patch shall be compared with
if the transition code is .

Check for continuity of curvature values and principal normal directions of the isoparametric curves in the cross-boundary direction at the same locations described above is also required if the transition code is . To check continuity of the curvature values, let r1 and r2 be the two curvature radius values. Then change ratio of the curvature radii is determined as ( 2*|r1-r2| ) / ( |r1| + |r2| ). If this change ratio is larger than the , then it is not curvature continuous. The difference in principal normal directions shall be compared against .

Geometry having continuity greater than the transition code shall not be detected by this criterion except for the case where the start patch and the end patch share a common patch boundary curve although the transition code of the last segment is .

A Narrow_surface_patch is a type of . It asserts that a has too narrow a dimension for one knot interval. A patch of a surface is narrow if at every point on the patch there is a point on the patch boundary within half the distance tolerance. The measurement requirement corresponding to this entity requires that the measurement shall calculate the distance described above at sufficient points on a patch so that the calculation satisfies the given accuracy.
a that tests if there exists any patch with the width smaller than the given tolerance, which is the case ’TRUE’, or not.

A Nearly_degenerate_geometry is a type of that is a supertype of criteria for detecting nearly degenerate geometry data.

A Nearly_degenerate_surface_boundary is a type of . It asserts that a or a
has one or more partially degenerate boundary curves.
See IP2 of ISO 10303-42:2003, 4.4.68 for reference.
The measurement requirement corresponding to this entity requires that the measurement shall calculate curve lengths of the all the boundary curves of the surface for comparing them with the given threshold in assessment. The surface in Figure 22 shall be detected by this criterion when the boundary curve length "l" is larger than the lower limit, and smaller than the upper limit of the threshold. Completely degenerated surface boundary is allowed in most CAD systems and is very often treated appropriately. ext_description.p: A Nearly_degenerate_surface_patch is a type of . It asserts that a has one or more patches which have one or more degenerate boundary curves. Degenerate boundary curves on a natural boundary whose length is less than the lower bound value of the threshold are not the target of this criterion. The measurement requirement corresponding to this entity requires that the measurement shall calculate curve lengths of all the boundary curves of each patch of a , that will be compared with the given threshold in assessment.
ext_description.note:
In Figure 23, solid lines show natural boundary curves and dashed lines show patch boundary curves of a surface. If "l", a patch boundary curve length as shown
in Figure 23, is smaller than the upper limit of the threshold, this surface shall be detected by this criterion as having quality defect. As described in NOTE 2 of , the lower limit of the threshold is used to compare only with lengths of the natural boundary curves for excluding completely degenerated natural boundary. A patch boundary curve shall be detected by this criterion even if its length is smaller than the lower limit when it is not on any natural boundary curve. If it is on any natural boundary curve then it shall be detected when its length is larger than the lower limit of the threshold.

A Non_manifold_at_vertex is a type of . It asserts that a under inspection contains one or more s where s connected to it are in non-manifold situation. The measurement requirement corresponding to this entity requires that the measurement shall take the following processes. First, it shall create a list of the s that connect to the under inspection. Then it shall select any from the list and mark s of that using that . The next selected is any sharing one of the already marked s connected to that . After edges connected to the test , of the second are similarly marked, the process continues by looking for another sharing an already marked . If at the end of this process, there are s in the list whose edges are not yet been marked, then that s are non-manifold at the .
This test does not detect Non_manifold_at_vertex at s related to . Therefore, this criterion shall always be applied together with .
A typical case to be detected by this criterion is shown in Figure 25.

A Partly_overlapping_curves is a type of . It asserts that two s are partly overlapping. Two s overlap if each contains an arcwise connected set of points such that every point in the set for one is within from the other . Arc length of the overlapping portion shall be evaluated for each and the longer one is required to be greater than or equal to the minimum of the specified threshold and the shorter arc length of the two s under inspection. In Figure 28, l shows the length of overlapping portion of two s and t shows the threshold length. This case shall be detected by this criterion because l is greater than t. Figure 29 shows a case where a shorter than the threshold entirely lies on another within . This case shall also be detected by this criterion because length of overlapping portion is equal to the arc length of the shorter .

A Self_intersecting_curve is a type of . This entity asserts that a curve has self-intersection within its domain. The measurement requirement corresponding to this entity requires that the measurement shall detect points on the curve, which are within each other, with arc length distance between them greater than the value determined by multiplying the with . In the case of the closed curve, pairs of points whose arc length is within the of the start point or the end point shall be excluded from the test. For the purpose of this test, a closed curve is one where the distance from the start point to the end point is less than .
In Figure 30, d is the distance between two points on the curve and l is the arc length distance between the points.
Self-intersecting curve

This entity asserts that a surface has self-intersection within its domain. The measurement requirement corresponding to this entity requires that the measurement shall detect points on the surface, which are within of each other, with a geodesic line distance between them greater than the value determined by multiplying the with . In the case of the closed surface, pairs of points where the arc length distance following an isoparametric curve from the boundary is less than shall be excluded from the test. A Unused_patches is a type of . This entity asserts that bounds of a uses only a small portion of its face geometry. The measurement requirement corresponding to this entity requires that the measurement shall calculate bounding box of the outer bound of the face in parameter space and shall compare it with the parameter range of surface geometry. And then it shall count rows and columns of the patches not included in the bounding box for comparison with the given threshold in assessment.
a that tests the calculated number of rows or columns against the given threshold.

A Wrongly_oriented_void is a type of . This entity asserts that the orientation of a void shell is illegal. The measurement requirement corresponding to this entity requires that the measurement shall check if the orientation of a void is toward outside of the void, which is the case 'TRUE', or not. For properly defined void, the judgement shall always be 'FALSE'.

A Wrongly_placed_loop is a type of . This entity asserts that geometric location of s in a face is illegal. The measurement requirement corresponding to this entity requires that the measurement shall detect two cases, one is the case where an inner loop is located outside of the outer loop, and the other is the case where an inner loop is located inside another inner loop.
Typical cases to be detected by this criterion are shown in Figure 35 and Figure 37. The case when an inner loop located outside the outer loop is touching with the outer loop is shown in Figure 36. This case shall be detected by this criterion and also by .

A Wrongly_placed_void is a type of . This entity asserts that a void is wrongly placed with respect to other shells in a solid. The measurement requirement corresponding to this entity requires that the measurement shall check if a void is located outside of the outer shell of a solid or if it is located inside of another void shell.
A void intersecting with the outer shell and intersecting voids shall be detected by the criterion .

A Zero_surface_normal is a type of . This entity asserts that a surface has one or more points on it where two tangent vectors in u and v directions are parallel within tolerance. This kind of surfaces may cause significant problems in various geometric calculations because magnitude of normal vector is infinitesimal at that point. The measurement requirement corresponding to this entity requires that the measurement shall calculate the angle of tangent vectors in u and v directions at any point on the surface and shall find out the case when it is close to zero within the given tolerance or it is close to 180 degree within the given tolerance.
The case where angle between u and v vectors is close to 180 degree is shown in Figure 41, and the case where angle between u and v vectors is close to zero degree is shown in Figure 42. Both cases shall be detected by this criterion.
